Text:
They dash into the alleyway that Cid found by chance,
but the search is already proving difficult.

I can't find any clues that might link us to the
culprit. I wonder where they were hiding...

It doesn't seem like there's anywhere to hide
in this narrow alleyway...
That's true, but...

I thought there would be an entrance somewhere, like
with the sliding door, but...I don't see any.
(Is this already a dead end...? But...)
Oh, around this corner is the main street.
...You're right.

...I guess we didn't find anything after all. How did
the kidnapper escape with the girl...?

(Even if her mouth was covered, I don't think they
could run down the main street with a screaming
child in their arms...)
(Someone would've noticed something was off. But...)

Beatrix looks around, but there doesn't seem to be any
kind of commotion.

Not even 30 minutes have passed since the mother came
crying to them, telling them about her missing daughter.

If the culprits are still on the run, she feels that
there should be some kind of reaction from
passerby.

(A horse-drawn carriage...? It's not unthinkable,
but it's unlikely.)

Judging by how Princess Iris spoke of the situation,

it is clear that the culprits are professionals.

The larger the scale of the crime, the easier it is
to trace. If they did use carriages, they are more
likely to leave a trail of witnesses.

(I don't see any connection to the kidnappers.
Are they running away on foot...?)
(Then where...?!)

(If they kidnap a commoner's child, they can't demand
a ransom. Human trafficking must be their goal.)

If so, it means that their search will become more
difficult as time passes.

They have no idea who they are dealing with, where
the culprits are from, or if there is a middleman.

(It's impossible to track where they're being
sold! We have to stop them before they leave
the country...!)

(I can't waste time thinking like this. Time is of
the essence, and if I don't act quickly, that
mother will suffer for eternity...!)

Beatrix begins to break out in a sweat, clenching her
jaw when Cid says something that knocks her off
her feet.

I feel like eating something sweet...When I think
really hard, I get hungry.
Huh...? What...?

Maybe it's because the server recommended that new
ice cream flavor when I bought a tuna sandwich and
Cola Cola earlier. I should've gone for it.

(I-Ice cream...? Why is he talking about ice cream at
a time like this...?)

But you know, ice cream melts and drips everywhere
after a while.
Drips...?
Yeah. Have you tried it before?

Vanilla ice cream is good, but it reeks of sugar.
When it melts and gets on your hands or clothes,
it's a pain to deal with.
(Yes! That's exactly it!)

I might've found a lead on how to find the girl...!
Way to go, Cid!
Huh? What're you talking about?

Cid looks at Beatrix with a more flabbergasted
expression than hers a moment ago. His face
has confusion written all over it. She wonders if
he is being serious or not.

(This is the second time that Cid has given me a
hint. I don't think this is a mere coincidence.
He sure is something...)

Anyway, rescuing the girl is our top priority right
now. We'll follow the clue The trail of melted
ice cream!

The trail of ice cream ends here. It seems that the
kidnapper went inside this store.
It feels like a store that has zero to do with crime.
Indeed...
(That's why I'm suspicious of it...)
Anyway, let's go inside.
Hello.
Welcome. Can I help you with anything?
Yeah...I'm looking for a 7-year-old girl.
Huh...? I don't have a daughter or anything...

A kidnapper should have brought her here. Where did
they hide her?

Wh-What are you talking about? As you can see, this
is just a doll store...! If you're just here for
jokes, please leave!

You're just feigning ignorance, but it's obvious
you're involved...I can smell the vanilla on
your apron.

More likely than not, the girl had a tantrum, and the
ice cream she was holding smeared on you.
Spit it out. Where's the girl?

Wh-What are you talking about...? I spilled
this on myself just now...hee hee.
Shameless...

(However, I don't see anything off in the store.
I don't hear a girl crying either. Where did
they hide her...?)
You know, we might have the wrong place.
What...? There's absolutely no way.

Y-You should listen to him! I'm not a kidnapper!
I'd never do such a horrible thing...!

Right? Look, he even said so himself.
Let's get out of here.
Cid, wait. I'm still not...!
Well, I'm bouncing, so you're on your own... Woah!

H-Hey...are you all right? It looked like you just
face-planted...
N-Not at all... Ouch...! Something snagged my leg...

What the heck is this? It looks like a handle...
on the floor? It looks like there's a door here.
A cellar door...!

Ah, no, th-that's...! J-Just an underground storage
area! It's cool, so it's very useful for
storing dolls!

Allow me to confirm. If it's just dolls, then there's
no harm in me looking, right?
Ugh...you... Don't do anything rash, you got that?!
U-Urgh...
That looks like it hurt.
I'm still the Goddess of War, you know.

Let's open the door. We have to save that little girl
and bring her back to her mother.
Anna...are you here, Anna? We're here to rescue you.
I hear something. Um, is that...crying?
*sniff*...*whimper*...
Who are...you?

(There's a boy here too...? It seems like he's about
13 or 14 years old. Is he a victim too...?)

I'm Beatrix, and this is Cid. We are here to
rescue you. You're safe now.
You're here...to save us?
Yes. Come with us, we'll leave here together.
You're...you're too late!
Watch out, Beatrix!
Huh?!
